content.svp: Manage and control project financials effectively and deliver projects within budget
content.parent_description: Project financials control involves defining work breakdown structures accurately, tracking actual versus planned costs, and identifying deviations and at-risk activities or issues.
description: Create a basis for hierarchical project financials and accounting by defining work breakdown structures accurately.
Plan and control costs and budgets efficiently by tracking actual versus planned costs.
Improve monitoring of progress and financial performance of projects by identifying deviations and at-risk activities or issues.

content.svp: Optimize project efficiency and deliver high-quality projects on time and within scope
content.parent_description: Project logistics control includes defining suitable work-breakdown and network structures to support project logistics planning and execution.
description: Improve planning and scheduling of project activities, resource demands, and materials with execution of project logistics and confirmation of work.
Prevent business disruptions by understanding all logistics-related execution aspects of a project
Support project logistics planning and execution by defining project structures.

content.svp: Optimize project efficiency and deliver high-quality projects on time and within scope
content.parent_description: Project logistics control includes defining suitable work-breakdown and network structures to support project logistics planning and execution.
description: Define project structures comprising suitable work breakdown and network structures for project logistics planning and execution.
Use simplified code and an optimized data model to streamline authorization and external views of core data services.
Prevent business disruptions by understanding logistics-related execution aspects of a project.

content.svp: Streamline and automate a bidirectional exchange of project information with external scheduling tools
content.parent_description: Project schedule management includes synchronizing project information between SAP and third-party project management tools by using field-mapping rules and process orchestration to ensure data integrity and accuracy at all stages of the communication process.
description: Synchronize project master data and project schedules with external third-party project management tools.
Translate project information into external formats and vice versa.
Use flexible field-mapping rules to automate value checks and create new data entries if missing in the target system.
Orchestrate the exchange process through business rules defining the sequence for dynamically creating and modifying project elements based on project types and other criteria.
Aggregate project information from lower project levels using predefined business rules.​

content.svp: Streamline and automate a bidirectional exchange of project information with external scheduling tools
content.parent_description: Project schedule management includes synchronizing project information between SAP and third-party project management tools by using field-mapping rules and process orchestration to ensure data integrity and accuracy at all stages of the communication process.
description: Translate project information into external formats.
Use flexible field-mapping rules that automate value checks, and create new field values if not in the source system.
Orchestrate the exchange process through business rules defining the sequence of creating and modifying project elements dynamically based on project types and other criteria.
Exchange plant maintenance orders with third-party scheduling tools for full processing maintenance, from planning and scheduling to execution and progress tracking.

content.svp: Streamline and automate a bidirectional exchange of project information with external scheduling tools

Use flexible field-mapping rules that automate value checks, and create new field values if not in the source system.
Orchestrate the exchange process through business rules defining the sequence of creating and modifying project elements dynamically based on project types and other criteria.
Exchange plant maintenance orders with third-party scheduling tools for full processing maintenance, from planning and scheduling to execution and progress tracking.

Project Schedule Management.description: Project schedule management includes synchronizing project information between SAP and third-party project management tools by using field-mapping rules and process orchestration to ensure data integrity and accuracy at all stages of the communication process.

Asset Network Collaboration for Asset De.description: One network channel for electronic data handover from OEM or constructors to asset operators

content.svp: Enable secure asset information collaboration across your business network
content.parent_description: Asset network and collaboration enables secure asset collaboration with the asset stakeholder throughout the entire asset lifecycle. Provide one network channel for electronic handover of technical asset and maintenance data to OEMs, service providers, and procurement vendors​
description: Collaborate with manufacturers, operators, service suppliers, across the network on asset information.
Provide one network channel for electronic handover of technical asset and maintenance data to OEMs, service providers, and procurement vendors.
Improve data reliability, reduce master data maintenance, and maintain higher asset availability.

Asset Network and Collaboration.description: Asset network and collaboration enables secure asset collaboration with the asset stakeholder throughout the entire asset lifecycle. Provide one network channel for electronic handover of technical asset and maintenance data to OEMs, service providers, and procurement vendors​

content.svp: Controlling maintenance work through clear safety instructions and permits
content.parent_description: Ability to establish an integrated process between asset management and EH&S in order to communicate pertinent safety risks and control the maintenance work being performed.
description: Link environment, health, and safety (EHS) information to technical equipment and plant maintenance tasks.
Help generate work order safety plans and concrete safety measures automatically.

Support flexible levels of permits natively integrated with the work order process in enterprise asset management. Automate the permit process enforces fully auditable procedures that promote consistent behavior.

content.svp: Controlling maintenance work through clear safety instructions and permits
content.parent_description: Ability to establish an integrated process between asset management and EH&S in order to communicate pertinent safety risks and control the maintenance work being performed.
description: Link environment, health, and safety (EHS) information to technical equipment and plant maintenance tasks.​
Help generate work-order safety plans and concrete safety measures automatically.​
Support flexible levels of permits natively integrated with the work-order process in enterprise asset management.​
Allow full user status enablement for work permits and safety certificates.​
Automate the permit process and enforce fully auditable procedures that promote consistent behavior.​
Accelerate the performance of daily work-permit processing as well as related safety certificates, such as isolation certificates for lock-out/tag-out procedures.​

Work Permit and Isolations Management.description: Ability to establish an integrated process between asset management and EH&S in order to communicate pertinent safety risks and control the maintenance work being performed.

content.svp: Manage the lifecycle of various asset data and information, from creation to archiving, with appropriate authorization control
content.parent_description: Ability to create, update, delete, and archive asset master, transactional, time series, and events data. It also involves the same management of business rules, unstructured data (documents, drawings of design models, and pictures), and location and spatial information across asset types including historical data according to data quality requirements.
description: Keep the master records of assets from acquisition through procurement or commissioning of a capital project, including functional and financial information, to archiving the data at the end of the assets' lifecycles.

Manage both master and transactional data required for asset management, such as assets, their associated unstructured data (documents and drawings), maintenance notifications and orders, lists of maintenance activities, and financial data related to the assets and maintenance, such as costs and other accounting information.
Enforce and audit access to data and information with appropriate authorization control across the organization.

content.svp: Manage the lifecycle of various asset data and information, from creation to archiving, with appropriate authorization control
content.parent_description: Ability to create, update, delete, and archive asset master, transactional, time series, and events data. It also involves the same management of business rules, unstructured data (documents, drawings of design models, and pictures), and location and spatial information across asset types including historical data according to data quality requirements.
description: Keep the master records of assets from acquisition through procurement, including their functional and financial information, to archiving the data at the end of the assets' lifecycles.

Manage both master and transactional data required for asset management, such as assets, their associated, unstructured data (documents and drawings), maintenance notifications and orders, lists of maintenance activities, and financial data related to the assets.
Manage both master and transactional data required for maintenance, such as costs and other accounting information.
Enforce and audit access to data and information with appropriate authorization controls across the organization.

content.parent_description: Ability to create, update, delete, and archive asset master, transactional, time series, and events data. content.svp: Create, update, delete, and archive asset master, transactional, time series, and events data and business rules for assets
content.parent_description: Ability to create, update, delete, and archive asset master, transactional, time series, and events data. It also involves the same management of business rules, unstructured data (documents, drawings of design models, and pictures), and location and spatial information across asset types including historical data according to data quality requirements.
description: Follow a systematic and coordinated approach for collecting, organizing, analyzing, and utilizing data and information related to assets throughout their lifecycles.

Establish processes, systems, and technologies to capture, store, and maintain accurate and reliable data about assets, including their specifications, performance, maintenance histories, and conditions.
Facilitate asset monitoring, analysis, and forecasting, using this information to support activities such as maintenance planning, risk assessment, and performance optimization.
Enhance asset management practices, improve efficiency, and maximize the value and performance of assets using this data and information.

content.svp: Geospatially enable maintenance processes for optimized asset management tasks
content.parent_description: Ability to create, update, delete, and archive asset master, transactional, time series, and events data. It also involves the same management of business rules, unstructured data (documents, drawings of design models, and pictures), and location and spatial information across asset types including historical data according to data quality requirements.
description: Institute geospatially-enabled business processes to prioritize work, optimize outages, and increase asset reliability​
Use simple, intuitive, and map-based navigation to enhance maintenance team productivity​
Rely on data federation with GIS systems for a more precise and timely view of your business to minimize operational risk

content.svp: Improve efficiency of maintenance operations with a centralized, streamlined, and native cloud data governance process for asset master data
content.parent_description: Asset information governance involves creating or changing information in a consistent way, and measuring asset data quality across sources and targets to help ensure legal and regulatory compliance and governance across all asset information repositories.
description: Optimize maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) with MDO Spares, by Prospecta Software, for improved efficiency.
Enhance enterprise asset management through the utilization of MDO Assets by Prospecta Software.
Optimize enterprise data management by leveraging MDO Customer One by Prospecta Software.
Assure data quality with MDO Product One by Prospecta Software.

content.svp: Improve efficiency of maintenance operations with centralized and streamlined data governance process for asset master data
content.parent_description: Asset information governance involves creating or changing information in a consistent way, and measuring asset data quality across sources and targets to help ensure legal and regulatory compliance and governance across all asset information repositories.
description: Maintain consistent definition, authorization, and replication of key master data entities.​
Govern the process of creation and changes to asset information in a consistent manner with built in workflows for accurate data throughout the asset lifecycle.​
Transform asset information to meet complex operations requirements.​
Create master data in a centralized manner, with a fully compliant governance process, and correlate disparate asset information.​
Ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements across all asset information repositories.​

content.svp: Improve efficiency of maintenance operations with centralized and streamlined data governance process for asset master data
content.parent_description: Asset information governance involves creating or changing information in a consistent way, and measuring asset data quality across sources and targets to help ensure legal and regulatory compliance and governance across all asset information repositories.
description: Maintain consistent definition, authorization, and replication of key master data entities.​
Govern the process of creation and changes to asset information in a consistent manner, with built in workflows for accurate data throughout the asset lifecycle.​
Transform asset information to meet complex operations requirements.​
Create master data in a centralized manner, with a fully compliant governance process, and correlate disparate asset information.​
Ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements across all asset information repositories.​

Asset Information Governance.description: Asset information governance involves creating or changing information in a consistent way, and measuring asset data quality across sources and targets to help ensure legal and regulatory compliance and governance across all asset information repositories.

content.svp: Establishes standards for asset data modeling and common asset data taxonomy across asset stakeholders and the whole asset lifecycle
content.parent_description: Ability to specify and establish standards for asset information to assure consistency, accuracy, and completeness throughout the asset management lifecycle and enable effective decision-making and optimization of asset performance. Asset information standards comprise the classification of assets to an agreed hierarchy, which allows for creation and management of the overall asset inventory. Additionally, they define the required attributes, common methods for categorizing asset defects and failures, and techniques for assessing and recording asset utilization and condition.

content.svp: Managing operational changes with thorough review, risk mitigation, and documentation approval
content.parent_description: Ability to introduce and monitor operational change within an organization so that it does not lead to unknown or uncontrolled risk.
description: Simplify change requests, automate involvement of people, and help ensure consistent execution via templates and rules.
Support mitigating risks caused by changes to equipment, substances, operating conditions, and procedures.
Support thorough review of changes to mitigate risks and document approval at key phases, without disrupting operations and harming employees, assets, and the environment.

content.svp: Leverage one network channel for handover of electronic data from OEMs or engineering and construction to asset operators
content.parent_description: Ability to commission an asset and handing over asset data from manufacturing or construction to maintenance operations.
description: Creates an asset foundation for OEMs, component suppliers, and operators.
Facilitates closer collaboration on the equipment definition among the asset stakeholders.
Enables handover of electronic asset data from OEMs and EPCs to operations.
Reduces the cost of commissioning master data using a common digital twin between the business partners.

content.svp: Leverage one network channel for handover of electronic data from OEMs or engineering and construction to asset operators
content.parent_description: Ability to commission an asset and handing over asset data from manufacturing or construction to maintenance operations.
description: Creates an asset foundation for OEMs, component suppliers, and operators.
Facilitates closer collaboration on the equipment definition among the asset stakeholders.
Enables handover of electronic asset data from OEMs and EPCs to operations.
Reduces the cost of commissioning master data using a common digital twin between the business partners.

Asset Commissioning.description: Ability to commission an asset and handing over asset data from manufacturing or construction to maintenance operations.

content.svp: Define and record the functional and physical attributes of assets, including the links between their components and changes over time
content.parent_description: Ability to identify, record, and manage the functional and physical attributes of assets, software, and related documentation including the links between the components of a system. It enables systematic control of changes to the identified asset attributes for maintaining integrity and traceability throughout the asset lifecycle.
description: Manage the structural links between components that make up a unit of an asset with various attributes for each component.

Record the detailed histories of serialized components and the events that are related to them, such as moving locations, acquisition through procurement, or installation and removal, with links to the related activities that caused such events, such as refurbishment orders, purchase orders for asset acquisition, or logistics movement.

Manage various characteristics that can be flexibly defined to describe different classes of assets, such as physical characteristics like size, dimensions, or weight, operational attributes like operational hours, and location and spatial information.

content.svp: Define and record the functional and physical attributes of assets, including the links between their components and changes over time
content.parent_description: Ability to identify, record, and manage the functional and physical attributes of assets, software, and related documentation including the links between the components of a system. It enables systematic control of changes to the identified asset attributes for maintaining integrity and traceability throughout the asset lifecycle.
description: Manage the structural links between components that make up a unit of an asset with various attributes for each component.

Manage various characteristics that can be flexibly defined to describe different classes of assets, such as physical characteristics like size, dimensions, or weight and operational attributes like operational hours.

content.svp: Define and record the functional and physical attributes of assets, including the links between their components and changes over time
content.parent_description: Ability to identify, record, and manage the functional and physical attributes of assets, software, and related documentation including the links between the components of a system. description: Manage the structural links between components that make up a unit of an asset with various attributes for each component.

Record the detailed histories of serialized components and the events that are related to them, such as moving locations, acquisition through procurement, or installation and removal, with links to the related activities that caused such events, such as refurbishment orders, purchase orders for asset acquisition, or logistics movement.

Manage various characteristics that can be flexibly defined to describe different classes of assets, such as physical characteristics like size, dimensions, or weight, operational attributes like operational hours, and location and spatial information.

content.svp: Establish a collaborative central asset repository to maintain common digital twins sourced from multiple systems and asset stakeholders
content.parent_description: Ability to identify, record, and manage the functional and physical attributes of assets, software, and related documentation including the links between the components of a system. It enables systematic control of changes to the identified asset attributes for maintaining integrity and traceability throughout the asset lifecycle.
description: Leverage a collaborative asset registry in the cloud that is central to engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC), operations and maintenance, and field service.
Enable flexibility in asset modeling.
Tap into the solution that is extensible in content, scalable to high volumes, and integrates with back-end solutions from SAP.

Asset Configuration Management.description: Ability to identify, record, and manage the functional and physical attributes of assets, software, and related documentation including the links between the components of a system. It enables systematic control of changes to the identified asset attributes for maintaining integrity and traceability throughout the asset lifecycle.

content.svp: Monitor current asset status, predict future problems, and initiate preventive measures
content.parent_description: Ability to track current asset status, predicting future problems, and initiating preventive measures.
description: Detect issues and assure optimal functionality with the ongoing process of monitoring asset conditions.
Collect and analyze data on operating parameters and environmental factors.
Gain real-time insights into asset health by monitoring indicators such as vibration, temperature, and pressure.
Enable early detection of anomalies, potential failures, and performance degradation to trigger proactive maintenance actions for preventing downtime, reducing costs, and optimizing asset lifespan.
Facilitate improved asset management and data-driven decisions for efficient operations.

content.svp: Monitor current asset status and initiate preventive measures
content.parent_description: Ability to track current asset status, predicting future problems, and initiating preventive measures.
description: Monitor the current functional and physical attributes of assets using measuring points and measuring documents.
Leverage predefined and predelivered conditions to define thresholds and limits for triggering maintenance notifications.

Asset Health Monitoring.description: Ability to track current asset status, predicting future problems, and initiating preventive measures.

content.svp: Maximize the economic values of high-value assets by refurbishing components in-house or replacing them through a subcontractor
content.parent_description: Ability to repair or remanufacture a defective or ineffective asset.
description: Manage the configuration structure of high-value assets with serialized serviceable components and process refurbishment appropriately, whether done in-house or through subcontracting.
Track procurement and repair history by serializing the repairable components of an asset.
Valuate the repairable components according to their statuses, such as new, repaired, or faulty.

content.svp: Maximize the economic values of high-value assets by refurbishing components in-house or replacing them through a subcontractor
content.parent_description: Ability to repair or remanufacture a defective or ineffective asset.
description: Manage the configuration structure of high-value assets with serialized serviceable components and process refurbishment appropriately, whether done in-house or through subcontracting.
Track procurement and repair history by serializing the repairable components of an asset.
Valuate the repairable components according to their statuses, such as new, repaired, or faulty.

Asset Refurbishment.description: Ability to repair or remanufacture a defective or ineffective asset.

content.svp: Apply reliability methodology across the asset lifecycle to assure optimal maintenance strategies for desired function and performance
content.parent_description: Ability to systematically apply reliability engineering principles and techniques throughout an asset’s lifecycle to assure its ability to perform a required function under given conditions for a given time interval. This involves identifying potential reliability issues as early as possible in the asset's lifecycle and making sure that all reliability requirements are met.
description: Follow a systematic and strategic approach to make sure assets perform their intended functions reliably throughout their lifecycles.
Identify and address potential failures, implement preventive and predictive maintenance strategies, and optimize asset performance.
Minimize unplanned downtime, extend asset life, and maximize overall operational efficiency.
Make data-driven decisions, conduct risk assessments, maintain condition monitoring, and facilitate continuous improvement.
Optimize maintenance activities, reduce costs, enhance safety, and improve the overall reliability and availability of critical assets.

Asset Reliability Engineering.description: Ability to systematically apply reliability engineering principles and techniques throughout an asset’s lifecycle to assure its ability to perform a required function under given conditions for a given time interval. This involves identifying potential reliability issues as early as possible in the asset's lifecycle and making sure that all reliability requirements are met.

content.svp: Maximize investment outcomes and optimize value with tools for strategic planning and execution, as well as adaptable capital plans
content.parent_description: Ability to strategically plan, analyze, and optimize investment decisions for industrial assets, ensuring effective allocation of capital and maximizing long-term value.
description: Make value-based decisions aligned with your objectives to understand how every proposed project will contribute to organizational goals and targets.
Evaluate projects through a common value framework to inform trade-off decisions with accurate assessments of risk and value.
Compare project benefits across asset classes to help ensure funding and resources are allocated effectively across the organization.
Intuitively optimize investment plans, creating a portfolio that delivers maximum value and executing the right projects at the right time.
Evaluate a vast number of investment alternatives and identify which to fund – and when – to deliver the most value within targets and constraints.

Asset Investment Management.description: Ability to strategically plan, analyze, and optimize investment decisions for industrial assets, ensuring effective allocation of capital and maximizing long-term value.

content.svp: Optimize inventory levels while increasing asset availability by enabling a collaborative maintenance and operations planning (M&OP) process
content.parent_description: Ability to develop a comprehensive, long-term plan for managing assets aligned with an organization's vision, mission, and goals. This includes defining strategies and tactics to achieve the goals, as well as establishing performance metrics and measures to monitor progress and success.
description: Avoid unscheduled asset downtime due to missing MRO parts by bringing maintenance and supply planning together.
Optimize spare parts inventory levels for maintenance, repair, and operations.
Improve mid- to long-term visibility of required MRO parts and labor resources.
Enhance maintenance planning processes through preconfigured integration with plant maintenance and project system functionality in SAP ERP.

content.svp: Optimize inventory levels while increasing asset availability by enabling a collaborative Maintenance & Operations Planning (M&OP) process.
content.parent_description: Ability to develop a comprehensive, long-term plan for managing assets aligned with an organization's vision, mission, and goals. This includes defining strategies and tactics to achieve the goals, as well as establishing performance metrics and measures to monitor progress and success.
description: Avoid unscheduled asset downtime due to missing parts for. maintenance, repair, and operations (MRO) by bringing maintenance & supply planning together
Optimize parts inventory levels for maintenance, repair, and operations (MRO)
Improve mid- to long-term visibility of required maintenance, repair, and operations (MRO)parts & labor resources
Enhance maintenance planning processes through out-of-the-box integration with SAP S/4HANA Enterprise Asset Management and Project System

Strategic Asset Management Planning.description: Ability to develop a comprehensive, long-term plan for managing assets aligned with an organization's vision, mission, and goals. This includes defining strategies and tactics to achieve the goals, as well as establishing performance metrics and measures to monitor progress and success.

content.svp: Create and process any type of work request
content.parent_description: Ability to react systematically to failures and events involving an organization’s assets. It includes detecting and identifying the incident, performing fault analysis, using standard responses, implementing temporary and permanent repair procedures, accessing the site and handing it back, and reporting and updating asset information accordingly.
description: Describe the technical problem of an object.
Request the maintenance department to perform a necessary task.
Document work that has been performed.

content.svp: Create and process work requests for asset malfunctions and breakdowns
content.parent_description: Ability to react systematically to failures and events involving an organization’s assets. It includes detecting and identifying the incident, performing fault analysis, using standard responses, implementing temporary and permanent repair procedures, accessing the site and handing it back, and reporting and updating asset information accordingly.
description: Describe the object's technical problem and record failure data such as object part, damage code, and causes of failure.
Request performance of necessary tasks by the maintenance department.
Plan, schedule, and perform repair activities by including relevant spare parts, labor, and external services.
Plan relevant activities considering workforce safety by integrating with the environment, health, and safety component.
Document the work that has been performed.

content.svp: Create and process work requests for asset malfunctions and breakdowns
content.parent_description: Ability to react systematically to failures and events involving an organization’s assets. It includes detecting and identifying the incident, performing fault analysis, using standard responses, implementing temporary and permanent repair procedures, accessing the site and handing it back, and reporting and updating asset information accordingly.
description: Describe the object's technical problem and record failure data such as object part, damage code, and causes of failure.
Request performanceof necessary tasks by the maintenance department.
Plan, schedule, and perform repair activities by including relevant spare parts, labor, and external services.
Plan relevant activities considering workforce safety by integrating with SAP Environment, Health, and Safety Management.
Document the work that has been performed.

content.parent_description: Ability to react systematically to failures and events involving an organization’s assets. It includes detecting and identifying the incident, performing fault analysis, using standard responses, implementing temporary and permanent repair procedures, accessing the site and handing it back, and reporting and updating asset information accordingly.
description: Describe the object's technical problem and record failure data such as object part, damage code, and causes of failure.
Request performance of necessary tasks by the maintenance department.
Plan, schedule, and perform repair activities by including relevant spare parts, labor, and external services.
Plan relevant activities considering workforce safety by integrating with the environment, health, and safety component.
Document the work that has been performed.

content.parent_description: Mobile asset management involves managing maintenance work orders, notifications, measurement readings, inspections, parts, attachments, and time recordings using mobile devices whether you’re online, offline, or occasionally connected. It also enables geographic information system (GIS) integration.

Enable easy and timely execution of end-to-end asset management on the go.​
Provide easy access to work order status, progress, and location to reduce maintenance cost.​

content.svp: Eliminate unplanned asset downtime with predictive maintenance and optimized service
content.parent_description: Asset Prediction and Optimization​ involves the monitoring of current asset health; the prediction of future health; the creation of health indicators, KPIs, and alerts; and the execution of maintenance corrective measures into the maintenance management system.
description: Use predictive maintenance and service capabilities and the Internet of Things to take corrective actions early and optimize availability of assets.​
Collect and analyze sensor data from physical assets to predict operational failure.​
Initiate countermeasures to prevent downtime through service or maintenance orders.​
Benefit from a 360-degree view across asset model, master, transactional, and performance data to optimize asset performance.​
Employ ready-to-use machine learning content per asset class to improve predictions.​

content.svp: Perform predictive maintenance based on an engineering digital twin and virtual sensors
content.parent_description: Asset Prediction and Optimization​ involves the monitoring of current asset health; the prediction of future health; the creation of health indicators, KPIs, and alerts; and the execution of maintenance corrective measures into the maintenance management system.
description: Generate additional IoT sensor data using virtual sensors based on a digital twin, without having to install any physical sensors on the asset.
Calculate the best-possible performance under given operation conditions.

Perform ML-based anomaly detection in asset performance management and predictive asset insights using virtual sensors and engineering KPIs that are generated in SAP Enterprise Product Development, for a full E2E process.

content.svp: Monitor, analyze, and optimize critical performance of assets
content.parent_description: Asset strategy and performance involves methods to manage risk, maintenance costs, downtime, and energy consumption to optimize return on assets across lifecycles by monitoring, reviewing, and improving maintenance activities. It helps you reduce bottlenecks, improve decision-making, and prevent incidents using a holistic view of asset types and maintenance strategies.

Leverage an objective approach to determine risk and criticality of assets.
Continuously monitor, review, and improve maintenance activities to optimize operations.

content.svp: Monitor and analyze asset maintenance costs from various perspectives directly in the single system for operations and finance combined
content.parent_description: Ability to monitor asset maintenance costs, from planning to closing. This also includes recognizing and adopting appropriate valuation practices.
description: Monitor and compare estimated, baseline, planned, and actual costs from current maintenance orders.
Slice and dice the aggregated data flexibly from different perspectives and use data visualization to identify the critical cost factors.
Drill into the single maintenance order details or any other level you require to find the most appropriate level of granularity for your analysis.

content.svp: Analyze asset performance to derive insights on possible maintenance and service strategies
content.parent_description: Ability to collect and analyze data, such as operational data, maintenance records, sensor readings, and other relevant metrics, to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that provide insights into asset behavior and potential issues. This information can also provide opportunities to enhance reliability, availability, efficiency, and effectiveness. The goal of asset performance analysis is to optimize asset utilization, minimize downtime, reduce maintenance costs, and maximize ROI from assets.
description: Systematically evaluate an asset's effectiveness and efficiency.
Collect and analyze data on performance indicators such as reliability, availability, maintainability, and safety.
Understand how well assets are fulfilling their functions, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions on maintenance and investments.
Examine performance trends and identify reliability issues and risks.
Optimize asset performance, improve operational efficiency, and achieve strategic goals.

content.svp: Analyze historical asset breakdowns at different levels, such as the company level, the single asset level, or by components or subsystems
content.parent_description: Ability to collect and analyze data, such as operational data, maintenance records, sensor readings, and other relevant metrics, to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that provide insights into asset behavior and potential issues. This information can also provide opportunities to enhance reliability, availability, efficiency, and effectiveness. The goal of asset performance analysis is to optimize asset utilization, minimize downtime, reduce maintenance costs, and maximize ROI from assets.
description: Review asset reliability by tracking damages related to the assets and identify frequent damages and their root causes by applying various filters.
Analyze asset performance with indicators such as time to repair, time between repairs, mean time for repairs, and mean time between repairs.
Navigate freely from data visualization and aggregated data to granular details of a single maintenance notification, as analysis requires.

content.svp: Analyze historical asset breakdowns at different levels, such as the company level, the single asset level, or by components
content.parent_description: Ability to collect and analyze data, such as operational data, maintenance records, sensor readings, and other relevant metrics, to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that provide insights into asset behavior and potential issues. This information can also provide opportunities to enhance reliability, availability, efficiency, and effectiveness. The goal of asset performance analysis is to optimize asset utilization, minimize downtime, reduce maintenance costs, and maximize ROI from assets.
description: Review asset reliability by tracking damages related to the assets and identify frequent damages and their root causes by applying various filters.
Analyze asset performance with indicators such as time to repair, time between repairs, mean time for repairs, and mean time between repairs.
Navigate freely from data visualization and aggregated data to granular details of a single maintenance notification, as analysis requires.

content.svp: Analyze historical asset breakdowns at different levels, such as the company level, the single asset level, or by components or subsystems
content.parent_description: Ability to collect and analyze data, such as operational data, maintenance records, sensor readings, and other relevant metrics, to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that provide insights into asset behavior and potential issues. This information can also provide opportunities to enhance reliability, availability, efficiency, and effectiveness. The goal of asset performance analysis is to optimize asset utilization, minimize downtime, reduce maintenance costs, and maximize ROI from assets.
description: Review asset reliability by tracking damages related to the assets and identify frequent damages and their root causes by applying various filters.
Analyze asset performance with indicators such as time to repair, time between repairs, mean time for repairs, and mean time between repairs.
Navigate freely from data visualization and aggregated data to granular details of a single maintenance notification, as analysis requires.

Asset Performance Analysis.description: Ability to collect and analyze data, such as operational data, maintenance records, sensor readings, and other relevant metrics, to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies that provide insights into asset behavior and potential issues. This information can also provide opportunities to enhance reliability, availability, efficiency, and effectiveness. The goal of asset performance analysis is to optimize asset utilization, minimize downtime, reduce maintenance costs, and maximize ROI from assets.

content.svp: Eliminate unplanned asset downtime with predictive maintenance and optimized service
content.parent_description: Asset Prediction and Optimization​ involves the monitoring of current asset health; the prediction of future health; the creation of health indicators, KPIs, and alerts; and the execution of maintenance corrective measures into the maintenance management system.
description: Use predictive maintenance and service capabilities and the Internet of Things to take corrective actions early and optimize availability of assets.​
Collect and analyze sensor data from physical assets to predict operational failure.​
Initiate countermeasures to prevent downtime through service or maintenance orders.​
Benefit from a 360-degree view across asset model, master, transactional, and performance data to optimize asset performance.​
Employ ready-to-use machine learning content per asset class to improve predictions.​

content.svp: Perform predictive maintenance based on an engineering digital twin and virtual sensors
content.parent_description: Asset Prediction and Optimization​ involves the monitoring of current asset health; the prediction of future health; the creation of health indicators, KPIs, and alerts; and the execution of maintenance corrective measures into the maintenance management system.
description: Generate additional IoT sensor data using virtual sensors based on a digital twin, without having to install any physical sensors on the asset.
Calculate the best-possible performance under given operation conditions.

Perform ML-based anomaly detection in asset performance management and predictive asset insights using virtual sensors and engineering KPIs that are generated in SAP Enterprise Product Development, for a full E2E process.

content.svp: Assess and monitor the risk of an asset in regard to different impacts to segment assets based on criticality
content.parent_description: Ability to evaluate and monitor the risk of an asset breaking down. This includes analyzing the failure probability as well as the impact of the consequences.
description: Evaluate and quantify the potential risks associated with an asset or a portfolio of assets.
Identify and analyze risks such as financial, operational, safety, environmental, and reputational risks that can impact asset performance and value.
Consider factors such as asset condition, criticality, vulnerability, and external threats.
Prioritize mitigation strategies, effectively allocate resources, and develop risk-management plans using comprehensive assessments to assure the resilience and longevity of assets.
Make informed decisions and proactively manage risks throughout the asset lifecycle.

Asset Risk Assessment.description: Ability to evaluate and monitor the risk of an asset breaking down. This includes analyzing the failure probability as well as the impact of the consequences.
